caption.p: Changes in the transverse and axial discoloration induced by different chemicals. (A, C, E) indicate discoloration length of the transverse, axial-upper, and axial-lower, respectively. (B, D, F) indicate discoloration area of the transverse, axial-upper, and axial-lower, respectively. Similar uppercase letters indicate that the temporal effect is not significantly different. Similar lowercase letters indicate that the treatment effect is not significantly different ( p > 0.05). Bar represents standard deviation.
